Question: What evidence exists to support or refute the claim of leaked transcripts from the Titan submersible?

Prediction.reasoning: Online search is necessary to gather authoritative information regarding the authenticity of the leaked transcripts and details on the investigation's findings. This will provide a comprehensive perspective on the matter.

Query1.query: Titan submersible leaked transcripts investigation findings
Query1.searching_goal: To find official statements and investigation reports that clarify the authenticity of the leaked transcripts related to the Titan submersible incident and to confirm whether they are indeed fabricated or not.

Query2.query: U.S. Coast Guard Titan submersible communication transcripts
Query2.searching_goal: To obtain information directly from U.S. Coast Guard or other official sources regarding the status of actual communications from the Titan submersible and any clarifications or evidence provided about the alleged transcripts.

Query1.title: Titan Submersible Investigation Declares Frightening Transcript a ...

content.content:
Advertisement
Supported by
The federal team investigating the Titan disaster found that a detailed recounting of the craft’s descent was “made up.”
By William J. Broad
Last year, a purported transcript of communications between the Titan submersible and its mother ship circulated widely on the internet. Viewed millions of times, the so-called log suggested that a series of alarms had turned a dive to the resting place of the Titanic into a heart-pounding crisis in which the five voyagers struggled in vain to return to the surface.
But the head of the U.S. federal government team investigating the disaster said that the entire transcript is a fiction. After nearly a year of investigation, his group has found no signs that the five voyagers aboard the Titan had any warning of the catastrophic implosion that was to take their lives. Two miles down, where seawater exerts vast pressures, an implosion would have made the violent collapse of the vehicle’s hull instantaneous.
“I’m confident it’s a false transcript,” said Capt. Jason D. Neubauer, who retired from the U.S. Coast Guard and serves as chairman of the Marine Board of Investigation, the agency’s highest level of inquiry. “It was made up.” Its authorship is not known.
Despite the log’s air of authenticity, the federal team saw through the pretense for a variety of reasons. Significantly, Mr. Neubauer’s team gained access to the records of the actual communications between the submersible and its mother ship, which remain an undisclosed part of the federal investigation.
He said that his team, aided by investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board, had “found no evidence” that Titan’s voyagers had any awareness of the imminent implosion or their fate.
His hope, Mr. Neubauer added, is that the truth will console relatives concerned that the five men inside the Titan may have suffered in their last moments.
We are having trouble retrieving the article content.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence directly states that the federal investigation found the transcripts to be fabricated. It provides authoritative verification from Capt. Jason D. Neubauer, making it highly relevant to the claim about the authenticity of leaked transcripts.

#### Breaking News
New twist revealed in doomed Titan submersible investigation unveils truth about frightening account logs
=========================================================================================================
By
News.com.au
Thanks for contacting us. We've received your submission.
Published June 11, 2024, 9:17 a.m. ET
#### 
]
A year-long investigation has revealed the disturbing log transcript of communications between the  and its mothership — a document that was circulated by millions online — was completely fake.
The logbook claimed to detail the final communications between the submersible, which was attempting to reach the Titanic with five voyagers on board, and the mothership.
There was widespread suspicion when the log documents were released last year, with many questioning whether the transcript between the two vessels was legitimate.
_,_ the head of the US government team investigating the disaster — including the nature and authenticity of the communication transcript — believes the entire log is fake.
  4]
Evidence in the Titan submersible investigation was deemed fake. via REUTERS
  4]
Five people died in the submersible. Dirty Dozen Productions/OceanGat/AFP via Getty Images
Capt. Jason D. Neubauer, who retired from the US Coast Guard and serves as chairman of the Marine Board of Investigation, said his investigation team has found no evidence that those on board the Titan knew a fatal implosion was about to occur.
“I’m confident it’s a false transcript … it was made up,” he said, as reported by the Times.
The logs, which were released and circulated by millions online from an unnamed author, revealed minute-by-minute communications allegedly between the submersible and the mothership.

The logs contained realistic descriptions of what one would imagine would occur on board in the final moments before the vessel imploded.
The logs also contained acronyms and technical words unique to the submersible, which at the time only further convinced readers the transcript was real.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence reiterates that the transcripts were completely fake according to the year's investigation results. It provides a strong dismissal of the claim made about the leaked transcripts, similar to evidence1.

Query1.title: Titan Sub Tragedy: Log of Passengers' Final Words Found to Be Fake
Query1.snippet: Jun 11, 2024 ... An investigation by the US federal government has found that the transcripts supposedly sent from the Titan submersible prior to its implosion in June 2023 ...

content.content:
New details have emerged about the tragic Titan submersible catastrophe.
Almost a year after the OceanGate submersible imploded while on its way to the wreckage of the Titanic, the U.S. federal government team investigating the tragedy has revealed that a transcript purporting to be a log of the final communications from the five people inside the vessel is a fake.
"I'm confident it's a false transcript," Captain Jason D. Neubauer, chairman of the Marine Board of Investigation, told The New York Times in an interview published June 10. "It was made up."
The fake transcript, which emerged at the end of June 2023, included communications between the Titan and its mother ship, the Polar Prince, during the sub's June 18 descent. The transcript also alleges the crew aboard the Titan told Polar Prince they were having issues with the submersible, before they ultimately stopped responding.
Neubauer, who noted his team hasn't identified the author of the fake log, said they have been able to access the real communications records between the Titan and the Polar Prince. As for whether the real transcript of the Titan's final communication will be released, the NYT noted they are still under wraps as the investigation continues.
But when it comes to the passengers' final moments, Neubauer's team, aided by investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board, "found no evidence" that they were aware of the imminent implosion.
Neubauer and his team hope that...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: E! Online primarily focuses on entertainment news and celebrity gossip, which may not always adhere to accurate journalism principles. It lacks the rigorous news reporting standards necessary for credible news.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This is highly relevant as it confirms that the transcripts were verified to be fake by the investigation team. It directly refutes the claim and offers solid backing from federal authorities.

content.content:
[Content truncated]... in depth federal investigation has revealed that a widely-viewed transcript of communications between the Titan submersible and its mother ship was fabricated.
**Updated:** Jun 11, 2024 07:47 AM EST
!
The Titan submersible
A federal officer and his team closely investigating the Titan submersible recently declared the transcripts between the submersible and the mother ship to be “fake.”
The log (transcript) was viewed countless times. It claimed that a series of alarms turned a dive to the resting place of the Titanic. As a result, it threw the Titan into an emergency, putting the lives of five people aboard in danger.
However, the US federal government team noted that the transcript was entirely fictional after almost a year of the incident. The group discovered no derogatory signs. This means the five passengers aboard weren’t warned of any catastrophic event that could threaten their lives.
Captain Neubauer denounces the falsified Titan submersible transcript
---------------------------------------------------------------------
According to Captain Jason D. Neubauer, it’s certain that there is no truth in the transcript.  mentioned Neubauer saying, “I’m confident it’s a false transcript and made up,”. The Captain recently retired from the US Coast Guard and serves as a chairman of the Marine Board of Investigation currently.
The Captain’s team had gotten hold of the records of the actual communication between the  and the mother ship. It revealed they “found no evidence” that the passengers knew of anything in advance.
“Somebody did it well enough to make it look plausible. The transcript made “it look like they were panicking,” Neubauer added. The log also consisted of several technical words and acronyms which then suggested its genuineness, which now seems hardly true.
Neubauer believes that with this recent development, the families of the deceased would gain some solace.
The five passengers were businessman Shahzada Dawood, 48, his son, Suleman, 19, Airline executive, Hamish Harding, 58, Paul-Henri Nargeolet, 77, and Stockton Rush, 61, who was the founder and chief executive of OceanGate. It’s an American firm that built the submersible and ran its tourist dives.
The passengers were hoping to wreck around 4000 meters below the ocean’s surface last year in June.
However, despite all odds, it seems like people still strive to explore the depths of the ocean. Especially the billionaires.
Pursuing ocean depths amidst tragedy
------------------------------------
Patrick Lahey,...[Content truncated]

QA.Question: What evidence exists to support or refute the claim of leaked transcripts from the Titan submersible?
QA.Answer:
To address the question of what evidence exists to support or refute the claim of leaked transcripts from the Titan submersible, the following points can be made based on recent investigations:

1. **Official Investigation Findings**: The U.S. federal government team investigating the Titan disaster, led by Capt. Jason D. Neubauer, has confirmed that the purported transcripts circulating online are entirely fabricated. They found no evidence suggesting any communications that would indicate the passengers aboard the Titan had any awareness of an impending catastrophic event, such as an implosion. Neubauer stated, “I’m confident it’s a false transcript,” which significantly undermines the credibility of the leaked documents.

2. **Access to Actual Communication Records**: The investigation team had access to the authentic communications between the Titan submersible and its mother ship (the Polar Prince), which were not disclosed publicly but revealed no alarms or distress signals from the submersible prior to the incident. This directly contradicts the claims made in the alleged transcripts that described a crisis scenario.

3. **Expert Testimony**: Capt. Neubauer, in his role as chairman of the Marine Board of Investigation, emphasized their comprehensive inquiry, reinforcing that after nearly a year’s investigation, they found no signs that the passengers were warned of the impending disaster. His expert testimony, alongside detailed review of actual communication logs, serves as a critical refutation of the leaked transcript claim.

4. **Lack of Authorship and Plausibility**: The lack of a known author for the leaked transcripts raises questions about their authenticity. Despite their appearance of plausibility, the transcripts were categorized by investigators as a complete fabrication, suggesting that although they presented technical jargon, they were ultimately designed to mislead rather than accurately reflect the events.

In conclusion, the evidence overwhelmingly refutes the claim of leaked transcripts from the Titan submersible, as affirmed by the findings of the investigation team and their access to actual communication records.
